ingredients: 8 oz Oyster Mushrooms, torn into strips
1/2 head Red Cabbage, thinly sliced (about 4-5 cups)
8 oz Firm Tofu, pressed and cubed (optional)
1 Tbsp Brown Sugar or Maple Syrup
steps: If using tofu, press it for 15 minutes, then cube and pat dry
Heat 1 Tbsp oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat
If using tofu, add it and cook 3-4 minutes per side until golden. Transfer to a plate
Add remaining 1 Tbsp oil to the skillet
Add sliced shallots and cook 2-3 minutes until softened and lightly caramelized
Add garlic and ginger, cook 30 seconds until fragrant
Add oyster mushrooms and cook 4-5 minutes without stirring initially to get a good sear, then toss occasionally until golden
Add sliced red cabbage and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until cabbage is tender but still has some bite
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes
Pour sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat
Add tofu back to the skillet if using, and toss everything together
Cook for 1-2 minutes until sauce is absorbed and everything is heated through
Remove from heat and garnish with green onions and sesame seeds
Serve immediately over rice or vermicelli noodles, or enjoy as a side dish
title: Asian Mushroom and Red Cabbage Stir-Fry
